author: TNN
title: Delhi-Bound Flights Diverted: Delhi Flights Diverted and Delayed Due to Rain and Wind | Delhi News - Times of India
text: New Delhi: Around 30 Delhi-bound flights were diverted and over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport because of incessant rain, gusty winds of up to 45kmph and lightning on Wednesday night.Of the 30 flights diverted to other cities, 16 were of IndiGo, six of Air India, and one each of Vistara, Alliance Air, Air India Express, American Airlines, Emirates, Akasa Air, Cathay Pacific. A chartered flight too had to be diverted. Fifteen flights were diverted to Jaipur, nine to Lucknow, three to Amritsar, two to Ahmedabad, and one to Chandigarh between 7.30pm on Wednesday and 1am on Thursday.Indira Gandhi International Airport saw 68.3mm of rainfall till 8.30am on Thursday. The airport recorded a high wind speed at 27kmph, which rose to 45kmph at 7pm on Wednesday. “A frequent change in wind speed impacts flight take-off,” an official said.Many passengers complained about the delays. Anjali, a passenger, said: “My flight from Delhi to Bangkok was delayed by about five hours on Wednesday night. We had to board the flight in the rain as there was no shade.”Rohit Rathore, another passenger, wrote on X that his flight was delayed by over four-and-a-half hours.Delhi Metro recorded a higher number of passenger journeys on Wednesday at 66.6 lakh as against 65.3 lakh a day earlier.A Delhi Metro Rail Corporation official said the passenger journeys rose on Wednesday as many people preferred the metro when heavy rain lashed the city and caused traffic snarls and waterlogging.On June 28, when the city had seen heavy rain, DMRC had recorded over 69 lakh passenger journeys. We also published the following articles recentlyBiohazard on United Airlines flight: Crew vomiting, passengers ask for masks, flight divertedA United Airlines flight from Houston to Boston was diverted to Washington D.C. after a passenger's illness caused a biohazard situation. Both crew members and passengers started feeling unwell, leading to the emergency landing. The plane underwent a deep clean, with no medical assistance required for the 155 passengers and six crew members.112094025Passengers exact 'revenge' on Delta Airlines following flight delays - Did they go too far?Two passengers protested Delta Airlines by raiding its VIP lounge after their flights were delayed due to a Microsoft outage. They emptied hand sanitizer dispensers, poured out wine, and took magazines, documenting their actions on TikTok. The video has gone viral, capturing support from the online community. Delta has not yet responded.112055015Air Canada flight cancelled due to flight attendant's 'inappropriate behaviour'A Montreal-bound Air Canada flight from Casablanca was canceled after a flight attendant was caught on video yelling at a passenger over a blanket request. The incident occurred on Friday and resulted in passengers being delayed until Sunday. Air Canada confirmed the cancellation, switched crews, and offered compensation, expressing regret over the incident.112115126
